# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 5GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session
source.52e195b3:
* Single-strand is more easily decomposed than double-strand

> Percentage of single strands

> Maximum number of consecutive single strands

> Reciprocal of double-stranded ratio

> The reciprocal of the longest continuous number of double strands

> * ２本鎖より1本鎖の方が、分解されやすい

> > 1本鎖の割合

> > 1本鎖の最長連続数

> > 2本鎖の割合の逆数

> > 2本鎖の最長連続数の逆数

* Consecutive same bases in double strands (G-C, A-U) reduce stability

> Counting the number of consecutive bases in a double strand

> The longest consecutive number of the same base in a double strand

> * 2本鎖（G-C、A-U）における連続した同じ塩基は、安定性を下げる

> > 2本鎖における同塩基連続数のカウント

> > 2本鎖における同塩基の最長連続数

* Bond strength in double strand G-C> A-U> A-G

> Count of C in double strand

> Difference between C count and U count in 2 difference

> G-C = C count / A-U = U count / A-G = Pair number-C + U count

> * 2本鎖における結合の強さG-C＞A-U＞A-G

> > 2本鎖におけるCのカウント

> > 2本差におけるCのカウントとUのカウントの差

> > G-C＝Cのカウント/A-U＝Uのカウント/A-G＝ペア数−C+Uのカウント

* G-G pair is stable in 1-1 loop
> * 1−1ループはG-Gのペアが安定

* The G-U sequence is stable in the 2-2 loop.
> * 2−2ループはG-U配列が安定

* 3-base hairpin loop is unstable
> * ３塩基のヘアピンループは不安定

* The bases at the beginning and end of the loop are important
> * ループの始まりと終わりの塩基が重要
